author: Cligra
title: Nice idea, ugly set
review:
When I found out about this set (and 40020), I was fairly excited. I didn't expect this one to be that great, but even with those expectations, this set was more then disappointing.

Box/Instructions

A basic polybag packaging. A nice background image, but nothing really special here. The instructions are folded, of course.

Parts

Meh. Lots of hinged things, but nothing too unusual.

Minifigures

The spiders must have eaten them.

The build

At least this set actually HAS proper instructions, unlike 40020.

The completed model

Two ugly, ugly, spiders. They might work as Halloween decorations, but anything else is pretty much beyond them (although the larger one does go well with set 4865).

Summary

Blekh. At least it's cheap. Buy it, if you want two really ugly Halloween decorations.

author: tkettle9719
title: Build-A-Creepy-Halloween in a Bag
review:
I bought this set on clearance for $2.50 on LegoShop@Home. It adds some really nice decoration to Halloween, and is really cool since there's two.

Pros

  • -The color scheme is classic and perfect.
  • -This set is truly great in multiple copies, for your spider army.
  • …

Cons

  • -The spiders are quite fragile, in my opinion.
  • -Where are the spider pincers?
  • …

This set is really creepy-crawly, it looks really cool, and comes at a great price. Buy it!
